result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Justin F. Dickman was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to any other sentence

superMiscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample.  Undergo AODA assessment and any other counseling/treatment per agent.  No operation of motor vehicle w/o valid DL.  Not to go to taverns/bars/liquor stores or any business where primary purpose of business is sale of alcohol.  Absolute sobriety at all times.  ALL COURT ORDERED OBLIGATIONS TO BE PAID THROUGH CLERK OF COURTS WITHIN 60 DAYS OR SET UP PAYMENT ARRANGEMENTS.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin F. Dickman

records.addlTxt: Waiver of Preliminary Hearing/Plea/Sentencing Hearing held on 6/9/22 - BUlrich

11:34 AM Prosecuting attorney Michael X. Albrecht in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Justin F. Dickman in court.  Attorney Sasa G Johnen in court for Justin F. Dickman. Guilty Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court finds Defendant guilty.  Court imposes sentence.

Count 2: Dismissed

Count 1: 
WI State Prison for 6 1/2 years (1 1/2 years Initial Confinement/5 years Extended Supervision)  Consecutive
2 days credit
Submit to DNA Sample
Undergo any counseling per agent.
AODA & any other treatment
$1819.00 fine/costs, pay thru prison or set up a payment plan with Sauk Co. Clerk of Courts.
$100.00 blood draw cost, pay thru prison or set up a payment plan with Sauk Co. Clerk of Courts.
Provide DNA Sample 
36 months Driver License revocation
AODA
Ignition Interlock-Immediately & Upon Licensure
Absolute Sobriety
No operation of m/v w/o valid DL
Seek & Maintain full time employment
No presence upon any bars, taverns or liquor stores where primary business is sale of alcohol 
Eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program 
Eligible for Substance Abuse Program
Paperwork handed in court.
Preliminary hearing on June 9, 2022 at 11:30 am.

01:02 PM Defendant Justin F. Dickman in court with attorney Sasa G Johnen.  Gabriel David Arevalo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Johnen requests another return date in about 4 to 6 weeks and is hopeful matter will resolve at that time.  Matter reset for preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 11:30 am.
